00074 /*
00075  * support functions: we could use inter-module communication, but this
00076  * is more portable to other OS's
00077  */
00078 static struct obd_device *obd_device_alloc(void)
00079 {
00080         struct obd_device *obd;
00081 
00082         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(obd, obd_device_cachep, GFP_NOFS);
00083         if (obd != NULL) {
00084                 obd->obd_magic = OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC;
00085         }
00086         return obd;
00087 }
00088 
00089 static void obd_device_free(struct obd_device *obd)
00090 {
00091         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00092         LASSERTF(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC, "obd %p obd_magic %08x != %08x\n",
00093                  obd, obd->obd_magic, OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00094         if (obd->obd_namespace != NULL) {
00095                 CERROR("obd %p: namespace %p was not properly cleaned up (obd_force=%d)!\n",
00096                        obd, obd->obd_namespace, obd->obd_force);
00097                 LBUG();
00098         }
00099         lu_ref_fini(&obd->obd_reference);
00100         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(obd, obd_device_cachep);
00101 }
00102 
00103 struct obd_type *class_search_type(const char *name)
00104 {
00105         struct list_head *tmp;
00106         struct obd_type *type;
00107 
00108         spin_lock(&obd_types_lock);
00109         list_for_each(tmp, &obd_types) {
00110                 type = list_entry(tmp, struct obd_type, typ_chain);
00111                 if (strcmp(type->typ_name, name) == 0) {
00112                         spin_unlock(&obd_types_lock);
00113                         return type;
00114                 }
00115         }
00116         spin_unlock(&obd_types_lock);
00117         return NULL;
00118 }
00119 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_search_type);
00120 
00121 struct obd_type *class_get_type(const char *name)
00122 {
00123         struct obd_type *type = class_search_type(name);
00124 
00125 #ifdef HAVE_MODULE_LOADING_SUPPORT
00126         if (!type) {
00127                 const char *modname = name;
00128 
00129                 if (strcmp(modname, "obdfilter") == 0)
00130                         modname = "ofd";
00131 
00132                 if (strcmp(modname, LUSTRE_LWP_NAME) == 0)
00133                         modname = LUSTRE_OSP_NAME;
00134 
00135                 if (!strncmp(modname, LUSTRE_MDS_NAME, strlen(LUSTRE_MDS_NAME)))
00136                         modname = LUSTRE_MDT_NAME;
00137 
00138                 if (!request_module("%s", modname)) {
00139                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Loaded module '%s'\n", modname);
00140                         type = class_search_type(name);
00141                 } else {
00142                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x158, "Can't load module '%s'\n",
00143                                            modname);
00144                 }
00145         }
00146 #endif
00147         if (type) {
00148                 spin_lock(&type->obd_type_lock);
00149                 type->typ_refcnt++;
00150                 try_module_get(type->typ_dt_ops->o_owner);
00151                 spin_unlock(&type->obd_type_lock);
00152         }
00153         return type;
00154 }
00155 
00156 void class_put_type(struct obd_type *type)
00157 {
00158         LASSERT(type);
00159         spin_lock(&type->obd_type_lock);
00160         type->typ_refcnt--;
00161         module_put(type->typ_dt_ops->o_owner);
00162         spin_unlock(&type->obd_type_lock);
00163 }
00164 
00165 #define CLASS_MAX_NAME 1024
00166 
00167 int class_register_type(struct obd_ops *dt_ops, struct md_ops *md_ops,
00168                         bool enable_proc, struct lprocfs_vars *vars,
00169                         const char *name, struct lu_device_type *ldt)
00170 {
00171         struct obd_type *type;
00172         int rc = 0;
00173         ENTRY;
00174 
00175         /* sanity check */
00176         LASSERT(strnlen(name, CLASS_MAX_NAME) < CLASS_MAX_NAME);
00177 
00178         if (class_search_type(name)) {
00179                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "Type %s already registered\n", name);
00180                 RETURN(-EEXIST);
00181         }
00182 
00183         rc = -ENOMEM;
00184         OBD_ALLOC(type, sizeof(*type));
00185         if (type == NULL)
00186                 RETURN(rc);
00187 
00188         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(type->typ_dt_ops);
00189         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(type->typ_md_ops);
00190         OBD_ALLOC(type->typ_name, strlen(name) + 1);
00191 
00192         if (type->typ_dt_ops == NULL ||
00193             type->typ_md_ops == NULL ||
00194             type->typ_name == NULL)
00195                 GOTO (failed, rc);
00196 
00197         *(type->typ_dt_ops) = *dt_ops;
00198         /* md_ops is optional */
00199         if (md_ops)
00200                 *(type->typ_md_ops) = *md_ops;
00201         strcpy(type->typ_name, name);
00202         spin_lock_init(&type->obd_type_lock);
00203 
00204 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00205         if (enable_proc) {
00206                 type->typ_procroot = lprocfs_register(type->typ_name,
00207                                                       proc_lustre_root,
00208                                                       vars, type);
00209                 if (IS_ERR(type->typ_procroot)) {
00210                         rc = PTR_ERR(type->typ_procroot);
00211                         type->typ_procroot = NULL;
00212                         GOTO(failed, rc);
00213                 }
00214         }
00215 #endif
00216         if (ldt != NULL) {
00217                 type->typ_lu = ldt;
00218                 rc = lu_device_type_init(ldt);
00219                 if (rc != 0)
00220                         GOTO (failed, rc);
00221         }
00222 
00223         spin_lock(&obd_types_lock);
00224         list_add(&type->typ_chain, &obd_types);
00225         spin_unlock(&obd_types_lock);
00226 
00227         RETURN (0);
00228 
00229 failed:
00230         if (type->typ_name != NULL) {
00231 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00232                 if (type->typ_procroot != NULL)
00233                         remove_proc_subtree(type->typ_name, proc_lustre_root);
00234 #endif
00235                 OBD_FREE(type->typ_name, strlen(name) + 1);
00236         }
00237         if (type->typ_md_ops != NULL)
00238                 OBD_FREE_PTR(type->typ_md_ops);
00239         if (type->typ_dt_ops != NULL)
00240                 OBD_FREE_PTR(type->typ_dt_ops);
00241         OBD_FREE(type, sizeof(*type));
00242         RETURN(rc);
00243 }
00244 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_register_type);
00245 
00246 int class_unregister_type(const char *name)
00247 {
00248         struct obd_type *type = class_search_type(name);
00249         ENTRY;
00250 
00251         if (!type) {
00252                 CERROR("unknown obd type\n");
00253                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00254         }
00255 
00256         if (type->typ_refcnt) {
00257                 CERROR("type %s has refcount (%d)\n", name, type->typ_refcnt);
00258                 /* This is a bad situation, let's make the best of it */
00259                 /* Remove ops, but leave the name for debugging */
00260                 OBD_FREE_PTR(type->typ_dt_ops);
00261                 OBD_FREE_PTR(type->typ_md_ops);
00262                 RETURN(-EBUSY);
00263         }
00264 
00265         /* we do not use type->typ_procroot as for compatibility purposes
00266          * other modules can share names (i.e. lod can use lov entry). so
00267          * we can't reference pointer as it can get invalided when another
00268          * module removes the entry */
00269 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00270         if (type->typ_procroot != NULL)
00271                 remove_proc_subtree(type->typ_name, proc_lustre_root);
00272         if (type->typ_procsym != NULL)
00273                 lprocfs_remove(&type->typ_procsym);
00274 #endif
00275         if (type->typ_lu)
00276                 lu_device_type_fini(type->typ_lu);
00277 
00278         spin_lock(&obd_types_lock);
00279         list_del(&type->typ_chain);
00280         spin_unlock(&obd_types_lock);
00281         OBD_FREE(type->typ_name, strlen(name) + 1);
00282         if (type->typ_dt_ops != NULL)
00283                 OBD_FREE_PTR(type->typ_dt_ops);
00284         if (type->typ_md_ops != NULL)
00285                 OBD_FREE_PTR(type->typ_md_ops);
00286         OBD_FREE(type, sizeof(*type));
00287         RETURN(0);
00288 } /* class_unregister_type */
00289 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_unregister_type);
00290 
00302 struct obd_device *class_newdev(const char *type_name, const char *name)
00303 {
00304         struct obd_device *result = NULL;
00305         struct obd_device *newdev;
00306         struct obd_type *type = NULL;
00307         int i;
00308         int new_obd_minor = 0;
00309         ENTRY;
00310 
00311         if (strlen(name) >= MAX_OBD_NAME) {
00312                 CERROR("name/uuid must be < %u bytes long\n", MAX_OBD_NAME);
00313                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-EINVAL));
00314         }
00315 
00316         type = class_get_type(type_name);
00317         if (type == NULL){
00318                 CERROR("OBD: unknown type: %s\n", type_name);
00319                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENODEV));
00320         }
00321 
00322         newdev = obd_device_alloc();
00323         if (newdev == NULL)
00324                 GOTO(out_type, result = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00325 
00326         LASSERT(newdev->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00327 
00328         write_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00329         for (i = 0; i < class_devno_max(); i++) {
00330                 struct obd_device *obd = class_num2obd(i);
00331 
00332                 if (obd && (strcmp(name, obd->obd_name) == 0)) {
00333                         CERROR("Device %s already exists at %d, won't add\n",
00334                                name, i);
00335                         if (result) {
00336                                 LASSERTF(result->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC,
00337                                          "%p obd_magic %08x != %08x\n", result,
00338                                          result->obd_magic, OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00339                                 LASSERTF(result->obd_minor == new_obd_minor,
00340                                          "%p obd_minor %d != %d\n", result,
00341                                          result->obd_minor, new_obd_minor);
00342 
00343                                 obd_devs[result->obd_minor] = NULL;
00344                                 result->obd_name[0]='\0';
00345                          }
00346                         result = ERR_PTR(-EEXIST);
00347                         break;
00348                 }
00349                 if (!result && !obd) {
00350                         result = newdev;
00351                         result->obd_minor = i;
00352                         new_obd_minor = i;
00353                         result->obd_type = type;
00354                         strncpy(result->obd_name, name,
00355                                 sizeof(result->obd_name) - 1);
00356                         obd_devs[i] = result;
00357                 }
00358         }
00359         write_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00360 
00361         if (result == NULL && i >= class_devno_max()) {
00362                 CERROR("all %u OBD devices used, increase MAX_OBD_DEVICES\n",
00363                        class_devno_max());
00364                 GOTO(out, result = ERR_PTR(-EOVERFLOW));
00365         }
00366 
00367         if (IS_ERR(result))
00368                 GOTO(out, result);
00369 
00370         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "Adding new device %s (%p)\n",
00371                result->obd_name, result);
00372 
00373         RETURN(result);
00374 out:
00375         obd_device_free(newdev);
00376 out_type:
00377         class_put_type(type);
00378         return result;
00379 }
00380 
00381 void class_release_dev(struct obd_device *obd)
00382 {
00383         struct obd_type *obd_type = obd->obd_type;
00384 
00385         LASSERTF(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC, "%p obd_magic %08x != %08x\n",
00386                  obd, obd->obd_magic, OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00387         LASSERTF(obd == obd_devs[obd->obd_minor], "obd %p != obd_devs[%d] %p\n",
00388                  obd, obd->obd_minor, obd_devs[obd->obd_minor]);
00389         LASSERT(obd_type != NULL);
00390 
00391         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Release obd device %s at %d obd_type name =%s\n",
00392                obd->obd_name, obd->obd_minor, obd->obd_type->typ_name);
00393 
00394         write_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00395         obd_devs[obd->obd_minor] = NULL;
00396         write_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00397         obd_device_free(obd);
00398 
00399         class_put_type(obd_type);
00400 }
00401 
00402 int class_name2dev(const char *name)
00403 {
00404         int i;
00405 
00406         if (!name)
00407                 return -1;
00408 
00409         read_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00410         for (i = 0; i < class_devno_max(); i++) {
00411                 struct obd_device *obd = class_num2obd(i);
00412 
00413                 if (obd && strcmp(name, obd->obd_name) == 0) {
00414                         /* Make sure we finished attaching before we give
00415                            out any references */
00416                         LASSERT(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00417                         if (obd->obd_attached) {
00418                                 read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00419                                 return i;
00420                         }
00421                         break;
00422                 }
00423         }
00424         read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00425 
00426         return -1;
00427 }
00428 
00429 struct obd_device *class_name2obd(const char *name)
00430 {
00431         int dev = class_name2dev(name);
00432 
00433         if (dev < 0 || dev > class_devno_max())
00434                 return NULL;
00435         return class_num2obd(dev);
00436 }
00437 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_name2obd);
00438 
00439 int class_uuid2dev(struct obd_uuid *uuid)
00440 {
00441         int i;
00442 
00443         read_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00444         for (i = 0; i < class_devno_max(); i++) {
00445                 struct obd_device *obd = class_num2obd(i);
00446 
00447                 if (obd && obd_uuid_equals(uuid, &obd->obd_uuid)) {
00448                         LASSERT(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00449                         read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00450                         return i;
00451                 }
00452         }
00453         read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00454 
00455         return -1;
00456 }
00457 
00458 struct obd_device *class_uuid2obd(struct obd_uuid *uuid)
00459 {
00460         int dev = class_uuid2dev(uuid);
00461         if (dev < 0)
00462                 return NULL;
00463         return class_num2obd(dev);
00464 }
00465 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_uuid2obd);
00466 
00475 struct obd_device *class_num2obd(int num)
00476 {
00477         struct obd_device *obd = NULL;
00478 
00479         if (num < class_devno_max()) {
00480                 obd = obd_devs[num];
00481                 if (obd == NULL)
00482                         return NULL;
00483 
00484                 LASSERTF(obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC,
00485                          "%p obd_magic %08x != %08x\n",
00486                          obd, obd->obd_magic, OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00487                 LASSERTF(obd->obd_minor == num,
00488                          "%p obd_minor %0d != %0d\n",
00489                          obd, obd->obd_minor, num);
00490         }
00491 
00492         return obd;
00493 }
00494 
00500 int get_devices_count(void)
00501 {
00502         int index, max_index = class_devno_max(), dev_count = 0;
00503 
00504         read_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00505         for (index = 0; index <= max_index; index++) {
00506                 struct obd_device *obd = class_num2obd(index);
00507                 if (obd != NULL)
00508                         dev_count++;
00509         }
00510         read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00511 
00512         return dev_count;
00513 }
00514 EXPORT_SYMBOL(get_devices_count);
00515 
00516 void class_obd_list(void)
00517 {
00518         char *status;
00519         int i;
00520 
00521         read_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00522         for (i = 0; i < class_devno_max(); i++) {
00523                 struct obd_device *obd = class_num2obd(i);
00524 
00525                 if (obd == NULL)
00526                         continue;
00527                 if (obd->obd_stopping)
00528                         status = "ST";
00529                 else if (obd->obd_set_up)
00530                         status = "UP";
00531                 else if (obd->obd_attached)
00532                         status = "AT";
00533                 else
00534                         status = "--";
00535                 LCONSOLE(D_CONFIG, "%3d %s %s %s %s %d\n",
00536                          i, status, obd->obd_type->typ_name,
00537                          obd->obd_name, obd->obd_uuid.uuid,
00538                          atomic_read(&obd->obd_refcount));
00539         }
00540         read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00541         return;
00542 }
00543 
00544 /* Search for a client OBD connected to tgt_uuid.  If grp_uuid is
00545    specified, then only the client with that uuid is returned,
00546    otherwise any client connected to the tgt is returned. */
00547 struct obd_device * class_find_client_obd(struct obd_uuid *tgt_uuid,
00548                                           const char * typ_name,
00549                                           struct obd_uuid *grp_uuid)
00550 {
00551         int i;
00552 
00553         read_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00554         for (i = 0; i < class_devno_max(); i++) {
00555                 struct obd_device *obd = class_num2obd(i);
00556 
00557                 if (obd == NULL)
00558                         continue;
00559                 if ((strncmp(obd->obd_type->typ_name, typ_name,
00560                              strlen(typ_name)) == 0)) {
00561                         if (obd_uuid_equals(tgt_uuid,
00562                                             &obd->u.cli.cl_target_uuid) &&
00563                             ((grp_uuid)? obd_uuid_equals(grp_uuid,
00564                                                          &obd->obd_uuid) : 1)) {
00565                                 read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00566                                 return obd;
00567                         }
00568                 }
00569         }
00570         read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00571 
00572         return NULL;
00573 }
00574 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_find_client_obd);
00575 
00576 /* Iterate the obd_device list looking devices have grp_uuid. Start
00577    searching at *next, and if a device is found, the next index to look
00578    at is saved in *next. If next is NULL, then the first matching device
00579    will always be returned. */
00580 struct obd_device * class_devices_in_group(struct obd_uuid *grp_uuid, int *next)
00581 {
00582         int i;
00583 
00584         if (next == NULL)
00585                 i = 0;
00586         else if (*next >= 0 && *next < class_devno_max())
00587                 i = *next;
00588         else
00589                 return NULL;
00590 
00591         read_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00592         for (; i < class_devno_max(); i++) {
00593                 struct obd_device *obd = class_num2obd(i);
00594 
00595                 if (obd == NULL)
00596                         continue;
00597                 if (obd_uuid_equals(grp_uuid, &obd->obd_uuid)) {
00598                         if (next != NULL)
00599                                 *next = i+1;
00600                         read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00601                         return obd;
00602                 }
00603         }
00604         read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00605 
00606         return NULL;
00607 }
00608 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_devices_in_group);
00609 
00614 int class_notify_sptlrpc_conf(const char *fsname, int namelen)
00615 {
00616         struct obd_device  *obd;
00617         const char         *type;
00618         int                 i, rc = 0, rc2;
00619 
00620         LASSERT(namelen > 0);
00621 
00622         read_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00623         for (i = 0; i < class_devno_max(); i++) {
00624                 obd = class_num2obd(i);
00625 
00626                 if (obd == NULL || obd->obd_set_up == 0 || obd->obd_stopping)
00627                         continue;
00628 
00629                 /* only notify mdc, osc, osp, lwp, mdt, ost
00630                  * because only these have a -sptlrpc llog */
00631                 type = obd->obd_type->typ_name;
00632                 if (strcmp(type, LUSTRE_MDC_NAME) != 0 &&
00633                     strcmp(type, LUSTRE_OSC_NAME) != 0 &&
00634                     strcmp(type, LUSTRE_OSP_NAME) != 0 &&
00635                     strcmp(type, LUSTRE_LWP_NAME) != 0 &&
00636                     strcmp(type, LUSTRE_MDT_NAME) != 0 &&
00637                     strcmp(type, LUSTRE_OST_NAME) != 0)
00638                         continue;
00639 
00640                 if (strncmp(obd->obd_name, fsname, namelen))
00641                         continue;
00642 
00643                 class_incref(obd, __FUNCTION__, obd);
00644                 read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00645                 rc2 = obd_set_info_async(NULL, obd->obd_self_export,
00646                                          sizeof(KEY_SPTLRPC_CONF),
00647                                          KEY_SPTLRPC_CONF, 0, NULL, NULL);
00648                 rc = rc ? rc : rc2;
00649                 class_decref(obd, __FUNCTION__, obd);
00650                 read_lock(&obd_dev_lock);
00651         }
00652         read_unlock(&obd_dev_lock);
00653         return rc;
00654 }
00655 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_notify_sptlrpc_conf);
00656 
00657 void obd_cleanup_caches(void)
00658 {
00659         ENTRY;
00660         if (obd_device_cachep) {
00661                 kmem_cache_destroy(obd_device_cachep);
00662                 obd_device_cachep = NULL;
00663         }
00664         if (obdo_cachep) {
00665                 kmem_cache_destroy(obdo_cachep);
00666                 obdo_cachep = NULL;
00667         }
00668         if (import_cachep) {
00669                 kmem_cache_destroy(import_cachep);
00670                 import_cachep = NULL;
00671         }
00672 
00673         EXIT;
00674 }
00675 
00676 int obd_init_caches(void)
00677 {
00678         int rc;
00679         ENTRY;
00680 
00681         LASSERT(obd_device_cachep == NULL);
00682         obd_device_cachep = kmem_cache_create("ll_obd_dev_cache",
00683                                               sizeof(struct obd_device),
00684                                               0, 0, NULL);
00685         if (!obd_device_cachep)
00686                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00687 
00688         LASSERT(obdo_cachep == NULL);
00689         obdo_cachep = kmem_cache_create("ll_obdo_cache", sizeof(struct obdo),
00690                                         0, 0, NULL);
00691         if (!obdo_cachep)
00692                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00693 
00694         LASSERT(import_cachep == NULL);
00695         import_cachep = kmem_cache_create("ll_import_cache",
00696                                           sizeof(struct obd_import),
00697                                           0, 0, NULL);
00698         if (!import_cachep)
00699                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00700 
00701         RETURN(0);
00702 out:
00703         obd_cleanup_caches();
00704         RETURN(rc);
00705 }
00706 
00707 /* map connection to client */
00708 struct obd_export *class_conn2export(struct lustre_handle *conn)
00709 {
00710         struct obd_export *export;
00711         ENTRY;
00712 
00713         if (!conn) {
00714                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "looking for null handle\n");
00715                 RETURN(NULL);
00716         }
00717 
00718         if (conn->cookie == -1) {  /* this means assign a new connection */
00719                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "want a new connection\n");
00720                 RETURN(NULL);
00721         }
00722 
00723         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "looking for export cookie "LPX64"\n", conn->cookie);
00724         export = class_handle2object(conn->cookie, NULL);
00725         RETURN(export);
00726 }
00727 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_conn2export);
00728 
00729 struct obd_device *class_exp2obd(struct obd_export *exp)
00730 {
00731         if (exp)
00732                 return exp->exp_obd;
00733         return NULL;
00734 }
00735 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_exp2obd);
00736 
00737 struct obd_device *class_conn2obd(struct lustre_handle *conn)
00738 {
00739         struct obd_export *export;
00740         export = class_conn2export(conn);
00741         if (export) {
00742                 struct obd_device *obd = export->exp_obd;
00743                 class_export_put(export);
00744                 return obd;
00745         }
00746         return NULL;
00747 }
00748 
00749 struct obd_import *class_exp2cliimp(struct obd_export *exp)
00750 {
00751         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00752         if (obd == NULL)
00753                 return NULL;
00754         return obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00755 }
00756 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_exp2cliimp);
00757 
00758 struct obd_import *class_conn2cliimp(struct lustre_handle *conn)
00759 {
00760         struct obd_device *obd = class_conn2obd(conn);
00761         if (obd == NULL)
00762                 return NULL;
00763         return obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00764 }
00765 
00766 /* Export management functions */
00767 static void class_export_destroy(struct obd_export *exp)
00768 {
00769         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
00770         ENTRY;
00771 
00772         LASSERT_ATOMIC_ZERO(&exp->exp_refcount);
00773         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
00774 
00775         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "destroying export %p/%s for %s\n", exp,
00776                exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid, obd->obd_name);
00777 
00778         /* "Local" exports (lctl, LOV->{mdc,osc}) have no connection. */
00779         if (exp->exp_connection)
00780                 ptlrpc_put_connection_superhack(exp->exp_connection);
00781 
00782         LASSERT(list_empty(&exp->exp_outstanding_replies));
00783         LASSERT(list_empty(&exp->exp_uncommitted_replies));
00784         LASSERT(list_empty(&exp->exp_req_replay_queue));
00785         LASSERT(list_empty(&exp->exp_hp_rpcs));
00786         obd_destroy_export(exp);
00787         class_decref(obd, "export", exp);
00788 
00789         OBD_FREE_RCU(exp, sizeof(*exp), &exp->exp_handle);
00790         EXIT;
00791 }
00792 
00793 static void export_handle_addref(void *export)
00794 {
00795         class_export_get(export);
00796 }
00797 
00798 static struct portals_handle_ops export_handle_ops = {
00799         .hop_addref = export_handle_addref,
00800         .hop_free   = NULL,
00801 };
00802 
00803 struct obd_export *class_export_get(struct obd_export *exp)
00804 {
00805         atomic_inc(&exp->exp_refcount);
00806         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "GETting export %p : new refcount %d\n", exp,
00807                atomic_read(&exp->exp_refcount));
00808         return exp;
00809 }
00810 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_export_get);
00811 
00812 void class_export_put(struct obd_export *exp)
00813 {
00814         LASSERT(exp != NULL);
00815         LASSERT_ATOMIC_GT_LT(&exp->exp_refcount, 0, LI_POISON);
00816         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "PUTting export %p : new refcount %d\n", exp,
00817                atomic_read(&exp->exp_refcount) - 1);
00818 
00819         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&exp->exp_refcount)) {
00820                 LASSERT(!list_empty(&exp->exp_obd_chain));
00821                 LASSERT(list_empty(&exp->exp_stale_list));
00822                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "final put %p/%s\n",
00823                        exp, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid);
00824 
00825                 /* release nid stat refererence */
00826                 lprocfs_exp_cleanup(exp);
00827 
00828                 obd_zombie_export_add(exp);
00829         }
00830 }
00831 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_export_put);
00832 
00833 /* Creates a new export, adds it to the hash table, and returns a
00834  * pointer to it. The refcount is 2: one for the hash reference, and
00835  * one for the pointer returned by this function. */
00836 struct obd_export *class_new_export(struct obd_device *obd,
00837                                     struct obd_uuid *cluuid)
00838 {
00839         struct obd_export *export;
00840         struct cfs_hash *hash = NULL;
00841         int rc = 0;
00842         ENTRY;
00843 
00844         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(export);
00845         if (!export)
00846                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00847 
00848         export->exp_conn_cnt = 0;
00849         export->exp_lock_hash = NULL;
00850         export->exp_flock_hash = NULL;
00851         atomic_set(&export->exp_refcount, 2);
00852         atomic_set(&export->exp_rpc_count, 0);
00853         atomic_set(&export->exp_cb_count, 0);
00854         atomic_set(&export->exp_locks_count, 0);
00855 #if LUSTRE_TRACKS_LOCK_EXP_REFS
00856         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&export->exp_locks_list);
00857         spin_lock_init(&export->exp_locks_list_guard);
00858 #endif
00859         atomic_set(&export->exp_replay_count, 0);
00860         export->exp_obd = obd;
00861         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&export->exp_outstanding_replies);
00862         spin_lock_init(&export->exp_uncommitted_replies_lock);
00863         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&export->exp_uncommitted_replies);
00864         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&export->exp_req_replay_queue);
00865         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&export->exp_handle.h_link);
00866         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&export->exp_hp_rpcs);
00867         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&export->exp_reg_rpcs);
00868         class_handle_hash(&export->exp_handle, &export_handle_ops);
00869         export->exp_last_request_time = cfs_time_current_sec();
00870         spin_lock_init(&export->exp_lock);
00871         spin_lock_init(&export->exp_rpc_lock);
00872         INIT_HLIST_NODE(&export->exp_uuid_hash);
00873         INIT_HLIST_NODE(&export->exp_nid_hash);
00874         INIT_HLIST_NODE(&export->exp_gen_hash);
00875         spin_lock_init(&export->exp_bl_list_lock);
00876         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&export->exp_bl_list);
00877         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&export->exp_stale_list);
00878 
00879         export->exp_sp_peer = LUSTRE_SP_ANY;
00880         export->exp_flvr.sf_rpc = SPTLRPC_FLVR_INVALID;
00881         export->exp_client_uuid = *cluuid;
00882         obd_init_export(export);
00883 
00884         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00885         /* shouldn't happen, but might race */
00886         if (obd->obd_stopping)
00887                 GOTO(exit_unlock, rc = -ENODEV);
00888 
00889         hash = cfs_hash_getref(obd->obd_uuid_hash);
00890         if (hash == NULL)
00891                 GOTO(exit_unlock, rc = -ENODEV);
00892         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00893 
00894         if (!obd_uuid_equals(cluuid, &obd->obd_uuid)) {
00895                 rc = cfs_hash_add_unique(hash, cluuid, &export->exp_uuid_hash);
00896                 if (rc != 0) {
00897                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: denying duplicate export for %s, %d\n",
00898                                       obd->obd_name, cluuid->uuid, rc);
00899                         GOTO(exit_err, rc = -EALREADY);
00900                 }
00901         }
00902 
00903         at_init(&export->exp_bl_lock_at, obd_timeout, 0);
00904         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00905         if (obd->obd_stopping) {
00906                 cfs_hash_del(hash, cluuid, &export->exp_uuid_hash);
00907                 GOTO(exit_unlock, rc = -ENODEV);
00908         }
00909 
00910         class_incref(obd, "export", export);
00911         list_add(&export->exp_obd_chain, &export->exp_obd->obd_exports);
00912         list_add_tail(&export->exp_obd_chain_timed,
00913                       &export->exp_obd->obd_exports_timed);
00914         export->exp_obd->obd_num_exports++;
00915         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00916         cfs_hash_putref(hash);
00917         RETURN(export);
00918 
00919 exit_unlock:
00920         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00921 exit_err:
00922         if (hash)
00923                 cfs_hash_putref(hash);
00924         class_handle_unhash(&export->exp_handle);
00925         LASSERT(hlist_unhashed(&export->exp_uuid_hash));
00926         obd_destroy_export(export);
00927         OBD_FREE_PTR(export);
00928         return ERR_PTR(rc);
00929 }
00930 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_new_export);
00931 
00932 void class_unlink_export(struct obd_export *exp)
00933 {
00934         class_handle_unhash(&exp->exp_handle);
00935 
00936         spin_lock(&exp->exp_obd->obd_dev_lock);
00937         /* delete an uuid-export hashitem from hashtables */
00938         if (!hlist_unhashed(&exp->exp_uuid_hash))
00939                 cfs_hash_del(exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid_hash,
00940                              &exp->exp_client_uuid,
00941                              &exp->exp_uuid_hash);
00942 
00943         if (!hlist_unhashed(&exp->exp_gen_hash)) {
00944                 struct tg_export_data   *ted = &exp->exp_target_data;
00945                 struct cfs_hash         *hash;
00946 
00947                 /* Because obd_gen_hash will not be released until
00948                  * class_cleanup(), so hash should never be NULL here */
00949                 hash = cfs_hash_getref(exp->exp_obd->obd_gen_hash);
00950                 LASSERT(hash != NULL);
00951                 cfs_hash_del(hash, &ted->ted_lcd->lcd_generation,
00952                              &exp->exp_gen_hash);
00953                 cfs_hash_putref(hash);
00954         }
00955 
00956         list_move(&exp->exp_obd_chain, &exp->exp_obd->obd_unlinked_exports);
00957         list_del_init(&exp->exp_obd_chain_timed);
00958         exp->exp_obd->obd_num_exports--;
00959         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_obd->obd_dev_lock);
00960         atomic_inc(&obd_stale_export_num);
00961 
00962         /* A reference is kept by obd_stale_exports list */
00963         obd_stale_export_put(exp);
00964 }
00965 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_unlink_export);
00966 
00967 /* Import management functions */
00968 static void class_import_destroy(struct obd_import *imp)
00969 {
00970         ENTRY;
00971 
00972         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "destroying import %p for %s\n", imp,
00973                 imp->imp_obd->obd_name);
00974 
00975         LASSERT_ATOMIC_ZERO(&imp->imp_refcount);
00976 
00977         ptlrpc_put_connection_superhack(imp->imp_connection);
00978 
00979         while (!list_empty(&imp->imp_conn_list)) {
00980                 struct obd_import_conn *imp_conn;
00981 
00982                 imp_conn = list_entry(imp->imp_conn_list.next,
00983                                       struct obd_import_conn, oic_item);
00984                 list_del_init(&imp_conn->oic_item);
00985                 ptlrpc_put_connection_superhack(imp_conn->oic_conn);
00986                 OBD_FREE(imp_conn, sizeof(*imp_conn));
00987         }
00988 
00989         LASSERT(imp->imp_sec == NULL);
00990         class_decref(imp->imp_obd, "import", imp);
00991         OBD_FREE_RCU(imp, sizeof(*imp), &imp->imp_handle);
00992         EXIT;
00993 }
00994 
00995 static void import_handle_addref(void *import)
00996 {
00997         class_import_get(import);
00998 }
00999 
01000 static struct portals_handle_ops import_handle_ops = {
01001         .hop_addref = import_handle_addref,
01002         .hop_free   = NULL,
01003 };
01004 
01005 struct obd_import *class_import_get(struct obd_import *import)
01006 {
01007         atomic_inc(&import->imp_refcount);
01008         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "import %p refcount=%d obd=%s\n", import,
01009                atomic_read(&import->imp_refcount),
01010                import->imp_obd->obd_name);
01011         return import;
01012 }
01013 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_import_get);
01014 
01015 void class_import_put(struct obd_import *imp)
01016 {
01017         ENTRY;
01018 
01019         LASSERT(list_empty(&imp->imp_zombie_chain));
01020         LASSERT_ATOMIC_GT_LT(&imp->imp_refcount, 0, LI_POISON);
01021 
01022         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "import %p refcount=%d obd=%s\n", imp,
01023                atomic_read(&imp->imp_refcount) - 1,
01024                imp->imp_obd->obd_name);
01025 
01026         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&imp->imp_refcount)) {
01027                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "final put import %p\n", imp);
01028                 obd_zombie_import_add(imp);
01029         }
01030 
01031         /* catch possible import put race */
01032         LASSERT_ATOMIC_GE_LT(&imp->imp_refcount, 0, LI_POISON);
01033         EXIT;
01034 }
01035 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_import_put);
01036 
01037 static void init_imp_at(struct imp_at *at) {
01038         int i;
01039         at_init(&at->iat_net_latency, 0, 0);
01040         for (i = 0; i < IMP_AT_MAX_PORTALS; i++) {
01041                 /* max service estimates are tracked on the server side, so
01042                    don't use the AT history here, just use the last reported
01043                    val. (But keep hist for proc histogram, worst_ever) */
01044                 at_init(&at->iat_service_estimate[i], INITIAL_CONNECT_TIMEOUT,
01045                         AT_FLG_NOHIST);
01046         }
01047 }
01048 
01049 struct obd_import *class_new_import(struct obd_device *obd)
01050 {
01051         struct obd_import *imp;
01052 
01053         OBD_ALLOC(imp, sizeof(*imp));
01054         if (imp == NULL)
01055                 return NULL;
01056 
01057         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&imp->imp_pinger_chain);
01058         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&imp->imp_zombie_chain);
01059         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&imp->imp_replay_list);
01060         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&imp->imp_sending_list);
01061         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&imp->imp_delayed_list);
01062         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&imp->imp_committed_list);
01063         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&imp->imp_unreplied_list);
01064         imp->imp_known_replied_xid = 0;
01065         imp->imp_replay_cursor = &imp->imp_committed_list;
01066         spin_lock_init(&imp->imp_lock);
01067         imp->imp_last_success_conn = 0;
01068         imp->imp_state = LUSTRE_IMP_NEW;
01069         imp->imp_obd = class_incref(obd, "import", imp);
01070         mutex_init(&imp->imp_sec_mutex);
01071         init_waitqueue_head(&imp->imp_recovery_waitq);
01072 
01073         atomic_set(&imp->imp_refcount, 2);
01074         atomic_set(&imp->imp_unregistering, 0);
01075         atomic_set(&imp->imp_inflight, 0);
01076         atomic_set(&imp->imp_replay_inflight, 0);
01077         atomic_set(&imp->imp_inval_count, 0);
01078         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&imp->imp_conn_list);
01079         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&imp->imp_handle.h_link);
01080         class_handle_hash(&imp->imp_handle, &import_handle_ops);
01081         init_imp_at(&imp->imp_at);
01082 
01083         /* the default magic is V2, will be used in connect RPC, and
01084          * then adjusted according to the flags in request/reply. */
01085         imp->imp_msg_magic = LUSTRE_MSG_MAGIC_V2;
01086 
01087         return imp;
01088 }
01089 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_new_import);
01090 
01091 void class_destroy_import(struct obd_import *import)
01092 {
01093         LASSERT(import != NULL);
01094         LASSERT(import != LP_POISON);
01095 
01096         class_handle_unhash(&import->imp_handle);
01097 
01098         spin_lock(&import->imp_lock);
01099         import->imp_generation++;
01100         spin_unlock(&import->imp_lock);
01101         class_import_put(import);
01102 }
01103 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_destroy_import);
01104 
01105 #if LUSTRE_TRACKS_LOCK_EXP_REFS
01106 
01107 void __class_export_add_lock_ref(struct obd_export *exp, struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01108 {
01109         spin_lock(&exp->exp_locks_list_guard);
01110 
01111         LASSERT(lock->l_exp_refs_nr >= 0);
01112 
01113         if (lock->l_exp_refs_target != NULL &&
01114             lock->l_exp_refs_target != exp) {
01115                 LCONSOLE_WARN("setting export %p for lock %p which already has export %p\n",
01116                               exp, lock, lock->l_exp_refs_target);
01117         }
01118         if ((lock->l_exp_refs_nr ++) == 0) {
01119                 list_add(&lock->l_exp_refs_link, &exp->exp_locks_list);
01120                 lock->l_exp_refs_target = exp;
01121         }
01122         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "lock = %p, export = %p, refs = %u\n",
01123                lock, exp, lock->l_exp_refs_nr);
01124         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_locks_list_guard);
01125 }
01126 
01127 void __class_export_del_lock_ref(struct obd_export *exp, struct ldlm_lock *lock)
01128 {
01129         spin_lock(&exp->exp_locks_list_guard);
01130         LASSERT(lock->l_exp_refs_nr > 0);
01131         if (lock->l_exp_refs_target != exp) {
01132                 LCONSOLE_WARN("lock %p, "
01133                               "mismatching export pointers: %p, %p\n",
01134                               lock, lock->l_exp_refs_target, exp);
01135         }
01136         if (-- lock->l_exp_refs_nr == 0) {
01137                 list_del_init(&lock->l_exp_refs_link);
01138                 lock->l_exp_refs_target = NULL;
01139         }
01140         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "lock = %p, export = %p, refs = %u\n",
01141                lock, exp, lock->l_exp_refs_nr);
01142         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_locks_list_guard);
01143 }
01144 #endif
01145 
01146 /* A connection defines an export context in which preallocation can
01147    be managed. This releases the export pointer reference, and returns
01148    the export handle, so the export refcount is 1 when this function
01149    returns. */
01150 int class_connect(struct lustre_handle *conn, struct obd_device *obd,
01151                   struct obd_uuid *cluuid)
01152 {
01153         struct obd_export *export;
01154         LASSERT(conn != NULL);
01155         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
01156         LASSERT(cluuid != NULL);
01157         ENTRY;
01158 
01159         export = class_new_export(obd, cluuid);
01160         if (IS_ERR(export))
01161                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(export));
01162 
01163         conn->cookie = export->exp_handle.h_cookie;
01164         class_export_put(export);
01165 
01166         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "connect: client %s, cookie "LPX64"\n",
01167                cluuid->uuid, conn->cookie);
01168         RETURN(0);
01169 }
01170 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_connect);
01171 
01172 /* if export is involved in recovery then clean up related things */
01173 static void class_export_recovery_cleanup(struct obd_export *exp)
01174 {
01175         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
01176 
01177         spin_lock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01178         if (obd->obd_recovering) {
01179                 if (exp->exp_in_recovery) {
01180                         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
01181                         exp->exp_in_recovery = 0;
01182                         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
01183                         LASSERT_ATOMIC_POS(&obd->obd_connected_clients);
01184                         atomic_dec(&obd->obd_connected_clients);
01185                 }
01186 
01187                 /* if called during recovery then should update
01188                  * obd_stale_clients counter,
01189                  * lightweight exports are not counted */
01190                 if ((exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT) == 0)
01191                         exp->exp_obd->obd_stale_clients++;
01192         }
01193         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_recovery_task_lock);
01194 
01195         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
01197         if (exp->exp_req_replay_needed) {
01198                 exp->exp_req_replay_needed = 0;
01199 
01200                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&obd->obd_req_replay_clients));
01201                 atomic_dec(&obd->obd_req_replay_clients);
01202         }
01203 
01205         if (exp->exp_lock_replay_needed) {
01206                 exp->exp_lock_replay_needed = 0;
01207 
01208                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&obd->obd_lock_replay_clients));
01209                 atomic_dec(&obd->obd_lock_replay_clients);
01210         }
01211         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
01212 }
01213 
01214 /* This function removes 1-3 references from the export:
01215  * 1 - for export pointer passed
01216  * and if disconnect really need
01217  * 2 - removing from hash
01218  * 3 - in client_unlink_export
01219  * The export pointer passed to this function can destroyed */
01220 int class_disconnect(struct obd_export *export)
01221 {
01222         int already_disconnected;
01223         ENTRY;
01224 
01225         if (export == NULL) {
01226                 CWARN("attempting to free NULL export %p\n", export);
01227                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01228         }
01229 
01230         spin_lock(&export->exp_lock);
01231         already_disconnected = export->exp_disconnected;
01232         export->exp_disconnected = 1;
01233         spin_unlock(&export->exp_lock);
01234 
01235         /* class_cleanup(), abort_recovery(), and class_fail_export()
01236          * all end up in here, and if any of them race we shouldn't
01237          * call extra class_export_puts(). */
01238         if (already_disconnected) {
01239                 LASSERT(hlist_unhashed(&export->exp_nid_hash));
01240                 GOTO(no_disconn, already_disconnected);
01241         }
01242 
01243         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "disconnect: cookie "LPX64"\n",
01244                export->exp_handle.h_cookie);
01245 
01246         if (!hlist_unhashed(&export->exp_nid_hash))
01247                 cfs_hash_del(export->exp_obd->obd_nid_hash,
01248                              &export->exp_connection->c_peer.nid,
01249                              &export->exp_nid_hash);
01250 
01251         class_export_recovery_cleanup(export);
01252         class_unlink_export(export);
01253 no_disconn:
01254         class_export_put(export);
01255         RETURN(0);
01256 }
01257 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_disconnect);
01258 
01259 /* Return non-zero for a fully connected export */
01260 int class_connected_export(struct obd_export *exp)
01261 {
01262         int connected = 0;
01263 
01264         if (exp) {
01265                 spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
01266                 connected = (exp->exp_conn_cnt > 0) && !exp->exp_failed;
01267                 spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
01268         }
01269         return connected;
01270 }
01271 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_connected_export);
01272 
01273 static void class_disconnect_export_list(struct list_head *list,
01274                                          enum obd_option flags)
01275 {
01276         int rc;
01277         struct obd_export *exp;
01278         ENTRY;
01279 
01280         /* It's possible that an export may disconnect itself, but
01281          * nothing else will be added to this list. */
01282         while (!list_empty(list)) {
01283                 exp = list_entry(list->next, struct obd_export,
01284                                  exp_obd_chain);
01285                 /* need for safe call CDEBUG after obd_disconnect */
01286                 class_export_get(exp);
01287 
01288                 spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
01289                 exp->exp_flags = flags;
01290                 spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
01291 
01292                 if (obd_uuid_equals(&exp->exp_client_uuid,
01293                                     &exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid)) {
01294                         CDEBUG(D_HA,
01295                                "exp %p export uuid == obd uuid, don't discon\n",
01296                                exp);
01297                         /* Need to delete this now so we don't end up pointing
01298                          * to work_list later when this export is cleaned up. */
01299                         list_del_init(&exp->exp_obd_chain);
01300                         class_export_put(exp);
01301                         continue;
01302                 }
01303 
01304                 class_export_get(exp);
01305                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: disconnecting export at %s (%p), "
01306                        "last request at "CFS_TIME_T"\n",
01307                        exp->exp_obd->obd_name, obd_export_nid2str(exp),
01308                        exp, exp->exp_last_request_time);
01309                 /* release one export reference anyway */
01310                 rc = obd_disconnect(exp);
01311 
01312                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "disconnected export at %s (%p): rc %d\n",
01313                        obd_export_nid2str(exp), exp, rc);
01314                 class_export_put(exp);
01315         }
01316         EXIT;
01317 }
01318 
01319 void class_disconnect_exports(struct obd_device *obd)
01320 {
01321         struct list_head work_list;
01322         ENTRY;
01323 
01324         /* Move all of the exports from obd_exports to a work list, en masse. */
01325         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&work_list);
01326         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01327         list_splice_init(&obd->obd_exports, &work_list);
01328         list_splice_init(&obd->obd_delayed_exports, &work_list);
01329         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01330 
01331         if (!list_empty(&work_list)) {
01332                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "OBD device %d (%p) has exports, "
01333                        "disconnecting them\n", obd->obd_minor, obd);
01334                 class_disconnect_export_list(&work_list,
01335                                              exp_flags_from_obd(obd));
01336         } else
01337                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "OBD device %d (%p) has no exports\n",
01338                        obd->obd_minor, obd);
01339         EXIT;
01340 }
01341 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_disconnect_exports);
01342 
01343 /* Remove exports that have not completed recovery.
01344  */
01345 void class_disconnect_stale_exports(struct obd_device *obd,
01346                                     int (*test_export)(struct obd_export *))
01347 {
01348         struct list_head work_list;
01349         struct obd_export *exp, *n;
01350         int evicted = 0;
01351         ENTRY;
01352 
01353         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&work_list);
01354         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01355         list_for_each_entry_safe(exp, n, &obd->obd_exports,
01356                                  exp_obd_chain) {
01357                 /* don't count self-export as client */
01358                 if (obd_uuid_equals(&exp->exp_client_uuid,
01359                                     &exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid))
01360                         continue;
01361 
01362                 /* don't evict clients which have no slot in last_rcvd
01363                  * (e.g. lightweight connection) */
01364                 if (exp->exp_target_data.ted_lr_idx == -1)
01365                         continue;
01366 
01367                 spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
01368                 if (exp->exp_failed || test_export(exp)) {
01369                         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
01370                         continue;
01371                 }
01372                 exp->exp_failed = 1;
01373                 spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
01374 
01375                 list_move(&exp->exp_obd_chain, &work_list);
01376                 evicted++;
01377                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: disconnect stale client %s@%s\n",
01378                        obd->obd_name, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
01379                        exp->exp_connection == NULL ? "<unknown>" :
01380                        libcfs_nid2str(exp->exp_connection->c_peer.nid));
01381                 print_export_data(exp, "EVICTING", 0);
01382         }
01383         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01384 
01385         if (evicted)
01386                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: disconnecting %d stale clients\n",
01387                               obd->obd_name, evicted);
01388 
01389         class_disconnect_export_list(&work_list, exp_flags_from_obd(obd) |
01390                                                  OBD_OPT_ABORT_RECOV);
01391         EXIT;
01392 }
01393 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_disconnect_stale_exports);
01394 
01395 void class_fail_export(struct obd_export *exp)
01396 {
01397         int rc, already_failed;
01398 
01399         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
01400         already_failed = exp->exp_failed;
01401         exp->exp_failed = 1;
01402         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
01403 
01404         if (already_failed) {
01405                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "disconnecting dead export %p/%s; skipping\n",
01406                        exp, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid);
01407                 return;
01408         }
01409 
01410         CDEBUG(D_HA, "disconnecting export %p/%s\n",
01411                exp, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid);
01412 
01413         if (obd_dump_on_timeout)
01414                 libcfs_debug_dumplog();
01415 
01416         /* need for safe call CDEBUG after obd_disconnect */
01417         class_export_get(exp);
01418 
01419         /* Most callers into obd_disconnect are removing their own reference
01420          * (request, for example) in addition to the one from the hash table.
01421          * We don't have such a reference here, so make one. */
01422         class_export_get(exp);
01423         rc = obd_disconnect(exp);
01424         if (rc)
01425                 CERROR("disconnecting export %p failed: %d\n", exp, rc);
01426         else
01427                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "disconnected export %p/%s\n",
01428                        exp, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid);
01429         class_export_put(exp);
01430 }
01431 EXPORT_SYMBOL(class_fail_export);
01432 
01433 char *obd_export_nid2str(struct obd_export *exp)
01434 {
01435         if (exp->exp_connection != NULL)
01436                 return libcfs_nid2str(exp->exp_connection->c_peer.nid);
01437 
01438         return "(no nid)";
01439 }
01440 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_export_nid2str);
01441 
01442 int obd_export_evict_by_nid(struct obd_device *obd, const char *nid)
01443 {
01444         struct cfs_hash *nid_hash;
01445         struct obd_export *doomed_exp = NULL;
01446         int exports_evicted = 0;
01447 
01448         lnet_nid_t nid_key = libcfs_str2nid((char *)nid);
01449 
01450         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01451         /* umount has run already, so evict thread should leave
01452          * its task to umount thread now */
01453         if (obd->obd_stopping) {
01454                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01455                 return exports_evicted;
01456         }
01457         nid_hash = obd->obd_nid_hash;
01458         cfs_hash_getref(nid_hash);
01459         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01460 
01461         do {
01462                 doomed_exp = cfs_hash_lookup(nid_hash, &nid_key);
01463                 if (doomed_exp == NULL)
01464                         break;
01465 
01466                 LASSERTF(doomed_exp->exp_connection->c_peer.nid == nid_key,
01467                          "nid %s found, wanted nid %s, requested nid %s\n",
01468                          obd_export_nid2str(doomed_exp),
01469                          libcfs_nid2str(nid_key), nid);
01470                 LASSERTF(doomed_exp != obd->obd_self_export,
01471                          "self-export is hashed by NID?\n");
01472                 exports_evicted++;
01473                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: evicting %s (at %s) by administrative "
01474                               "request\n", obd->obd_name,
01475                               obd_uuid2str(&doomed_exp->exp_client_uuid),
01476                               obd_export_nid2str(doomed_exp));
01477                 class_fail_export(doomed_exp);
01478                 class_export_put(doomed_exp);
01479         } while (1);
01480 
01481         cfs_hash_putref(nid_hash);
01482 
01483         if (!exports_evicted)
01484                 CDEBUG(D_HA,"%s: can't disconnect NID '%s': no exports found\n",
01485                        obd->obd_name, nid);
01486         return exports_evicted;
01487 }
01488 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_export_evict_by_nid);
01489 
01490 int obd_export_evict_by_uuid(struct obd_device *obd, const char *uuid)
01491 {
01492         struct cfs_hash *uuid_hash;
01493         struct obd_export *doomed_exp = NULL;
01494         struct obd_uuid doomed_uuid;
01495         int exports_evicted = 0;
01496 
01497         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01498         if (obd->obd_stopping) {
01499                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01500                 return exports_evicted;
01501         }
01502         uuid_hash = obd->obd_uuid_hash;
01503         cfs_hash_getref(uuid_hash);
01504         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01505 
01506         obd_str2uuid(&doomed_uuid, uuid);
01507         if (obd_uuid_equals(&doomed_uuid, &obd->obd_uuid)) {
01508                 CERROR("%s: can't evict myself\n", obd->obd_name);
01509                 cfs_hash_putref(uuid_hash);
01510                 return exports_evicted;
01511         }
01512 
01513         doomed_exp = cfs_hash_lookup(uuid_hash, &doomed_uuid);
01514 
01515         if (doomed_exp == NULL) {
01516                 CERROR("%s: can't disconnect %s: no exports found\n",
01517                        obd->obd_name, uuid);
01518         } else {
01519                 CWARN("%s: evicting %s at adminstrative request\n",
01520                        obd->obd_name, doomed_exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid);
01521                 class_fail_export(doomed_exp);
01522                 class_export_put(doomed_exp);
01523                 exports_evicted++;
01524         }
01525         cfs_hash_putref(uuid_hash);
01526 
01527         return exports_evicted;
01528 }
01529 
01530 #if LUSTRE_TRACKS_LOCK_EXP_REFS
01531 void (*class_export_dump_hook)(struct obd_export*) = NULL;
01532 #endif
01533 
01534 static void print_export_data(struct obd_export *exp, const char *status,
01535                               int locks)
01536 {
01537         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *rs;
01538         struct ptlrpc_reply_state *first_reply = NULL;
01539         int nreplies = 0;
01540 
01541         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
01542         list_for_each_entry(rs, &exp->exp_outstanding_replies,
01543                             rs_exp_list) {
01544                 if (nreplies == 0)
01545                         first_reply = rs;
01546                 nreplies++;
01547         }
01548         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
01549 
01550         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: %s %p %s %s %d (%d %d %d) %d %d %d %d: %p %s "LPU64"\n",
01551                exp->exp_obd->obd_name, status, exp, exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
01552                obd_export_nid2str(exp), atomic_read(&exp->exp_refcount),
01553                atomic_read(&exp->exp_rpc_count),
01554                atomic_read(&exp->exp_cb_count),
01555                atomic_read(&exp->exp_locks_count),
01556                exp->exp_disconnected, exp->exp_delayed, exp->exp_failed,
01557                nreplies, first_reply, nreplies > 3 ? "..." : "",
01558                exp->exp_last_committed);
01559 #if LUSTRE_TRACKS_LOCK_EXP_REFS
01560         if (locks && class_export_dump_hook != NULL)
01561                 class_export_dump_hook(exp);
01562 #endif
01563 }
01564 
01565 void dump_exports(struct obd_device *obd, int locks)
01566 {
01567         struct obd_export *exp;
01568 
01569         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01570         list_for_each_entry(exp, &obd->obd_exports, exp_obd_chain)
01571                 print_export_data(exp, "ACTIVE", locks);
01572         list_for_each_entry(exp, &obd->obd_unlinked_exports, exp_obd_chain)
01573                 print_export_data(exp, "UNLINKED", locks);
01574         list_for_each_entry(exp, &obd->obd_delayed_exports, exp_obd_chain)
01575                 print_export_data(exp, "DELAYED", locks);
01576         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01577         spin_lock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01578         list_for_each_entry(exp, &obd_zombie_exports, exp_obd_chain)
01579                 print_export_data(exp, "ZOMBIE", locks);
01580         spin_unlock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01581 }
01582 
01583 void obd_exports_barrier(struct obd_device *obd)
01584 {
01585         int waited = 2;
01586         LASSERT(list_empty(&obd->obd_exports));
01587         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01588         while (!list_empty(&obd->obd_unlinked_exports)) {
01589                 spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01590                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
01591                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(waited));
01592                 if (waited > 5 && IS_PO2(waited)) {
01593                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s is waiting for obd_unlinked_exports "
01594                                       "more than %d seconds. "
01595                                       "The obd refcount = %d. Is it stuck?\n",
01596                                       obd->obd_name, waited,
01597                                       atomic_read(&obd->obd_refcount));
01598                         dump_exports(obd, 1);
01599                 }
01600                 waited *= 2;
01601                 spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01602         }
01603         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
01604 }
01605 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_exports_barrier);
01606 
01607 /* Total amount of zombies to be destroyed */
01608 static int zombies_count = 0;
01609 
01613 void obd_zombie_impexp_cull(void)
01614 {
01615         struct obd_import *import;
01616         struct obd_export *export;
01617         ENTRY;
01618 
01619         do {
01620                 spin_lock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01621 
01622                 import = NULL;
01623                 if (!list_empty(&obd_zombie_imports)) {
01624                         import = list_entry(obd_zombie_imports.next,
01625                                             struct obd_import,
01626                                             imp_zombie_chain);
01627                         list_del_init(&import->imp_zombie_chain);
01628                 }
01629 
01630                 export = NULL;
01631                 if (!list_empty(&obd_zombie_exports)) {
01632                         export = list_entry(obd_zombie_exports.next,
01633                                             struct obd_export,
01634                                             exp_obd_chain);
01635                         list_del_init(&export->exp_obd_chain);
01636                 }
01637 
01638                 spin_unlock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01639 
01640                 if (import != NULL) {
01641                         class_import_destroy(import);
01642                         spin_lock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01643                         zombies_count--;
01644                         spin_unlock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01645                 }
01646 
01647                 if (export != NULL) {
01648                         class_export_destroy(export);
01649                         spin_lock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01650                         zombies_count--;
01651                         spin_unlock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01652                 }
01653 
01654                 cond_resched();
01655         } while (import != NULL || export != NULL);
01656         EXIT;
01657 }
01658 
01659 static struct completion        obd_zombie_start;
01660 static struct completion        obd_zombie_stop;
01661 static unsigned long            obd_zombie_flags;
01662 static wait_queue_head_t        obd_zombie_waitq;
01663 static pid_t                    obd_zombie_pid;
01664 
01665 enum {
01666         OBD_ZOMBIE_STOP         = 0x0001,
01667 };
01668 
01672 static int obd_zombie_impexp_check(void *arg)
01673 {
01674         int rc;
01675 
01676         spin_lock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01677         rc = (zombies_count == 0) &&
01678              !test_bit(OBD_ZOMBIE_STOP, &obd_zombie_flags);
01679         spin_unlock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01680 
01681         RETURN(rc);
01682 }
01683 
01687 static void obd_zombie_export_add(struct obd_export *exp) {
01688         atomic_dec(&obd_stale_export_num);
01689         spin_lock(&exp->exp_obd->obd_dev_lock);
01690         LASSERT(!list_empty(&exp->exp_obd_chain));
01691         list_del_init(&exp->exp_obd_chain);
01692         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_obd->obd_dev_lock);
01693         spin_lock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01694         zombies_count++;
01695         list_add(&exp->exp_obd_chain, &obd_zombie_exports);
01696         spin_unlock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01697 
01698         obd_zombie_impexp_notify();
01699 }
01700 
01704 static void obd_zombie_import_add(struct obd_import *imp) {
01705         LASSERT(imp->imp_sec == NULL);
01706         spin_lock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01707         LASSERT(list_empty(&imp->imp_zombie_chain));
01708         zombies_count++;
01709         list_add(&imp->imp_zombie_chain, &obd_zombie_imports);
01710         spin_unlock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01711 
01712         obd_zombie_impexp_notify();
01713 }
01714 
01718 static void obd_zombie_impexp_notify(void)
01719 {
01720         /*
01721          * Make sure obd_zomebie_impexp_thread get this notification.
01722          * It is possible this signal only get by obd_zombie_barrier, and
01723          * barrier gulps this notification and sleeps away and hangs ensues
01724          */
01725         wake_up_all(&obd_zombie_waitq);
01726 }
01727 
01731 static int obd_zombie_is_idle(void)
01732 {
01733         int rc;
01734 
01735         LASSERT(!test_bit(OBD_ZOMBIE_STOP, &obd_zombie_flags));
01736         spin_lock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01737         rc = (zombies_count == 0);
01738         spin_unlock(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01739         return rc;
01740 }
01741 
01745 void obd_zombie_barrier(void)
01746 {
01747         struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
01748 
01749         if (obd_zombie_pid == current_pid())
01750                 /* don't wait for myself */
01751                 return;
01752         l_wait_event(obd_zombie_waitq, obd_zombie_is_idle(), &lwi);
01753 }
01754 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_zombie_barrier);
01755 
01756 
01757 struct obd_export *obd_stale_export_get(void)
01758 {
01759         struct obd_export *exp = NULL;
01760         ENTRY;
01761 
01762         spin_lock(&obd_stale_export_lock);
01763         if (!list_empty(&obd_stale_exports)) {
01764                 exp = list_entry(obd_stale_exports.next,
01765                                  struct obd_export, exp_stale_list);
01766                 list_del_init(&exp->exp_stale_list);
01767         }
01768         spin_unlock(&obd_stale_export_lock);
01769 
01770         if (exp) {
01771                 CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Get export %p: total %d\n", exp,
01772                        atomic_read(&obd_stale_export_num));
01773         }
01774         RETURN(exp);
01775 }
01776 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_stale_export_get);
01777 
01778 void obd_stale_export_put(struct obd_export *exp)
01779 {
01780         ENTRY;
01781 
01782         LASSERT(list_empty(&exp->exp_stale_list));
01783         if (exp->exp_lock_hash &&
01784             atomic_read(&exp->exp_lock_hash->hs_count)) {
01785                 CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "Put export %p: total %d\n", exp,
01786                        atomic_read(&obd_stale_export_num));
01787 
01788                 spin_lock_bh(&exp->exp_bl_list_lock);
01789                 spin_lock(&obd_stale_export_lock);
01790                 /* Add to the tail if there is no blocked locks,
01791                  * to the head otherwise. */
01792                 if (list_empty(&exp->exp_bl_list))
01793                         list_add_tail(&exp->exp_stale_list,
01794                                       &obd_stale_exports);
01795                 else
01796                         list_add(&exp->exp_stale_list,
01797                                  &obd_stale_exports);
01798 
01799                 spin_unlock(&obd_stale_export_lock);
01800                 spin_unlock_bh(&exp->exp_bl_list_lock);
01801         } else {
01802                 class_export_put(exp);
01803         }
01804         EXIT;
01805 }
01806 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_stale_export_put);
01807 
01812 void obd_stale_export_adjust(struct obd_export *exp)
01813 {
01814         LASSERT(exp != NULL);
01815         spin_lock_bh(&exp->exp_bl_list_lock);
01816         spin_lock(&obd_stale_export_lock);
01817 
01818         if (!list_empty(&exp->exp_stale_list) &&
01819             !list_empty(&exp->exp_bl_list))
01820                 list_move(&exp->exp_stale_list, &obd_stale_exports);
01821 
01822         spin_unlock(&obd_stale_export_lock);
01823         spin_unlock_bh(&exp->exp_bl_list_lock);
01824 }
01825 EXPORT_SYMBOL(obd_stale_export_adjust);
01826 
01830 static int obd_zombie_impexp_thread(void *unused)
01831 {
01832         unshare_fs_struct();
01833         complete(&obd_zombie_start);
01834 
01835         obd_zombie_pid = current_pid();
01836 
01837         while (!test_bit(OBD_ZOMBIE_STOP, &obd_zombie_flags)) {
01838                 struct l_wait_info lwi = { 0 };
01839 
01840                 l_wait_event(obd_zombie_waitq,
01841                              !obd_zombie_impexp_check(NULL), &lwi);
01842                 obd_zombie_impexp_cull();
01843 
01844                 /*
01845                  * Notify obd_zombie_barrier callers that queues
01846                  * may be empty.
01847                  */
01848                 wake_up(&obd_zombie_waitq);
01849         }
01850 
01851         complete(&obd_zombie_stop);
01852 
01853         RETURN(0);
01854 }
01855 
01856 
01860 int obd_zombie_impexp_init(void)
01861 {
01862         struct task_struct *task;
01863 
01864         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd_zombie_imports);
01865 
01866         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&obd_zombie_exports);
01867         spin_lock_init(&obd_zombie_impexp_lock);
01868         init_completion(&obd_zombie_start);
01869         init_completion(&obd_zombie_stop);
01870         init_waitqueue_head(&obd_zombie_waitq);
01871         obd_zombie_pid = 0;
01872 
01873         task = kthread_run(obd_zombie_impexp_thread, NULL, "obd_zombid");
01874         if (IS_ERR(task))
01875                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(task));
01876 
01877         wait_for_completion(&obd_zombie_start);
01878         RETURN(0);
01879 }
01883 void obd_zombie_impexp_stop(void)
01884 {
01885         set_bit(OBD_ZOMBIE_STOP, &obd_zombie_flags);
01886         obd_zombie_impexp_notify();
01887         wait_for_completion(&obd_zombie_stop);
01888 }
